title: System Control Operators
description:
Unison owns, operates and maintains an extensive network that supplies electricity to more than 100,000 homes and businesses in the Hawkes Bay, Taupo and Rotorua regions. Being a leader in innovation and asset management, Unison is preparing itself for a changing energy future. This new future will rely not only on advanced technologies, systems and artificial intelligence, but also having competent people with the right skills and attitude.
  
Pivotal to achieving this vision is Unison's 24/7 Network Operations Centre (NOC) - a team of System Control Operators (SCO) and support engineers. The role of the SCO requires quick thinking, problem solving and responding to a variety of events in real-time.
  
The System Control Operator is responsible for:
  
Real-time operation of the network:
 
Coordinating planned and unplanned switching on the network.
Controlling access to high voltage network.
Providing first response coordination for Emergency Management.
Ensuring maintenance of prescribed supply limits and protection of system equipment.
Constantly monitoring loadings and implementing load control as required.
Monitoring and reporting the functionality of system equipment.
Utilisation of smart grid real time data to optimise the network and to increase operational efficiency.
Accurately collating information through historical and analytical reports.
Monitoring and managing Unisons' building and site security, including remote device security.
Courteously receiving customer complaints and enquiris 24/7.
Effectively handling faults and outages on the Network.
  
Preparing for and managing shutdowns during planned maintenance activities.
  
Preparing and building capability for flexible network services of the future.
  
We have numerous roles available so if this sounds like you, then please apply now. 
  
Are you interested in this role but are from outside the electrical industry? We would love to hear from you to see how this role could work for you.
  
Unison is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We also understand that great performance comes from great people. As a valued team member, you will receive ongoing training and development as well as a host of benefits including great remuneration, health insurance, and subsidies to enjoy an active and healthy lifestyle.
  
If you tick the boxes then we would love to hear from you. Apply now!
  
Applications Close: 3 May 2021
